ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] what's wrong with reading robots.txt
ygData.msgSnippet: If the site is still not crawled even without a robots.txt file you might want to take a look at the http-meta headers in the html-file(s) if the frontpage

<html><body>


<tt>
bjhong02 writes:<BR>
> I downloaded the binary of Heritrix 1.0.0, and tried to test it with<BR>
> the  seed: www.uiuc.edu. It succeed in dns lookup, but failed to read<BR>
> robots.txt (really exist).  The error log is as follows.<BR>
<BR>
Well, the error says that the read timed out --- can you get the<BR>
robots.txt file from your browser or from wget?<BR>
<BR>
> My another questioin is, how about if there's no robots.txt? it seems,<BR>
> in the normal setting, if there's no robots.txt for a server, the html<BR>
> pages on it will not be crawled. <BR>
<BR>
No. If there is no robots.txt then it is assumed that the server's<BR>
administration has no objections to being crawled, so everything is<BR>
fair game.<BR>
<BR>
-- <BR>
Tom Emerson                                          Basis Technology Corp.<BR>
Software Architect                                 <a href="http://www.basistech.com">http://www.basistech.com</a><BR>
  "Beware the lollipop of mediocrity: lick it once and you suck forever"<BR>
</tt>


<br>








</body></html>
